measured_by: Eating Disorder Examination Questionnaire (EDE-Q) Restraint subscale
justification: Participants showed "a wide range of restrictive eating tendencies as measured by the Eating Disorder Examination Questionnaire (EDE-Q 40)."
The authors controlled for "body image disturbances and concerns (BIDQ 51)" when analysing their main effects.
Impulsiveness was assessed with "the related psychological dimensions of impulsiveness (Barratt Impulsiveness Scale; BIS-11 52)."
They examined whether "obsessive-compulsive behaviours (Obsessive-Compulsive Inventory Short Version; OCI-R 53)" affected the results.

measured_by: Depression Anxiety Stress Scales-21 (DASS-21) – Depression scale
justification: Affective traits such as "depression, anxiety and stress (DASS-21 54)" were included as covariates.

measured_by: Depression Anxiety Stress Scales-21 (DASS-21) – Anxiety scale
justification: The study controlled for "depression, anxiety and stress (DASS-21 54)" when testing their models.

measured_by: Depression Anxiety Stress Scales-21 (DASS-21) – Stress scale
justification: "Affective traits such as depression, anxiety and stress (DASS-21 54)" were analysed for possible influence.

measured_by: Body and Balloon Analogue Risk Task (B-BART)
justification: The paper states "we developed a new risk analogue task ... which assesses body-related risk taking," and "the number of clicks ... was used as a primary index of explicit risk-taking."
